Setting.label: Friendly name
Setting.summary: This name will be used to identify this media server to other computers on your network. If you leave it blank, your computer's name will be used instead.

Setting.label: Send crash reports to Plex
Setting.summary: This helps us improve your experience.

Setting.label: Scan my library automatically
Setting.summary: Your library will be updated automatically when changes to library folders are detected.

Setting.label: Run a partial scan when changes are detected
Setting.summary: When changes to library folders are detected, only scan the folder that changed.

Setting.label: Include music libraries in automatic updates
Setting.summary: Linux systems limit the maximum number of watched directories; this may cause problems with large music libraries.

Setting.label: Empty trash automatically after every scan
Allow media deletion
Setting.summary: The owner of the server will be allowed to delete media files from disk.

Setting.label: Weeks to consider for Continue Watching
Setting.summary: Media that has not been watched in this many weeks will not appear in Continue Watching.

Setting.label: Maximum number of Continue Watching items which will appear.
Setting.summary: Limits the number of shows which will appear Continue Watching. Setting it too high can affect performance.

Setting.label: Include season premieres in Continue Watching
Setting.summary: New season premieres will always appear no matter how many weeks have passed since watching.

Setting.label: Enable smart shuffling on artists and smart music playlists
Setting.summary: Smart shuffling prefers highly rated, popular and less recently heard tracks.

Setting.label: Group albums by type
Setting.summary: Group into LPs, EPs & Singles, Compilations, Live Albums, Demos and Remixes.

Setting.label: Include Cinema Trailers from movies in my library
Include Cinema Trailers from new and upcoming movies in theaters
Setting.summary: This feature is Plex Pass only.

Setting.label: Include Cinema Trailers from new and upcoming movies on Blu-ray
Setting.summary: This feature is Plex Pass only.

Setting.label: Movie pre-roll video
Setting.summary: Enter the full path to the pre-roll video file. If multiple paths separated by commas are entered, videos will be played sequentially. If multiple paths separated by semi-colons are used, a single pre-roll video will be chosen randomly from the list.

Setting.label: Enable iTunes plugin
Setting.summary: A server restart is required for a change to take effect.

Setting.label: Disable capability checking
Setting.summary: Capability checking ensures that plug-ins that are incompatible with this version of the server or the current client application you are using are hidden. Disabling capability checking is useful during development, but will enable access to plug-ins that may perform unreliably with certain client applications.

Setting.label: A unique identifier for the machine
Has the user accepted the EULA
Comma-separated list of strings considered articles when sorting titles. A server restart is required for a change to take effect.
Maximum video output resolution for the transcoder
Secure connections
Setting.summary: When set to "Required", some unencrypted connections (originating from the Media Server computer) will still be allowed and apps that don't support secure connections will not be able to connect at all.

Setting.label: Custom certificate location
Setting.summary: Path to a PKCS #12 file containing a certificate and private key to enable TLS support on a custom domain.

Setting.label: Custom certificate domain
Setting.summary: Domain name to be published to plex.tv using your mapped port; must match a name from the custom certificate file.

Setting.label: Preferred network interface
Setting.summary: The network interface local clients will use to connect.

Setting.label: Strict TLS configuration
Setting.summary: Disables legacy weak ciphers, increases DH group size, and switches to ECDSA certificates when renewing. May prevent older clients from connecting.

Setting.label: Enable local network discovery (GDM)
Setting.summary: This enables the media server to discover other servers and players on the local network.

Setting.label: Publish server on Plex Online
Setting.summary: Publishing a server makes it automatically available on your client devices without any configuration of your router.

Setting.label: Push Notifications
Setting.summary: Allow this server to send push notifications to mobile devices. Note: Push notifications are delivered using Plex services. They're associated with your account, and some of them may contain information about the contents of your library.

Setting.label: Transcoder quality
Setting.summary: Quality profile used by the transcoder.
Setting.enumValues: 0:Automatic|1:Prefer higher speed encoding|2:Prefer higher quality encoding|3:Make my CPU hurt

Setting.label: Segmented transcoder timeout
Setting.summary: Timeout in seconds segmented transcodes wait for the transcoder to begin writing data.

Setting.label: Transcoder temporary directory
Setting.summary: Directory to use when transcoding for temporary files.

Setting.label: Transcoder default duration
Setting.summary: Duration in minutes to use when transcoding something with an unknown duration.

Setting.label: Transcoder default throttle buffer
Setting.summary: Amount in seconds to buffer before throttling the transcoder.

Setting.label: Transcoder default prune buffer
Setting.summary: Amount in past seconds to retain before pruning segments from a transcode.

Setting.label: Background transcoding x264 preset
Setting.summary: The x264 preset value used for background transcoding (Sync and Media Optimizer). Slower values will result in better video quality and smaller file sizes, but will take significantly longer to complete processing.

Setting.label: Enable HDR tone mapping
Setting.summary: Transcoded HDR content will appear highly dimmed and desaturated with this disabled. Additional driver components may be needed to support hardware transcoding with this feature enabled; see our support articles for further details.

Setting.label: Disable video stream transcoding
Setting.summary: Disable transcoding of the video stream in transcoder operations. With this set, the transcoder may still transcode audio as well as remux video.

Setting.label: Use hardware acceleration when available
Setting.summary: Plex Media Server will attempt to use hardware-accelerated video codecs when encoding and decoding video. Hardware acceleration can make transcoding faster and allow more simultaneous video transcodes, but it can also reduce video quality and compatibility.

Setting.label: Use hardware-accelerated video encoding
Setting.summary: If hardware acceleration is enabled, this controls whether it's used for encoding, in addition to decoding.

Setting.label: Number of seconds to wait before a plugin times out
Enable the DLNA server
Setting.summary: This allows the server to stream media to DLNA (Digital Living Network Alliance) devices.

Setting.label: DLNA client preferences
Setting.summary: Client-specific configuration settings for the DLNA server.

Setting.label: DLNA server timeline reporting
Setting.summary: Enable the DLNA server to report timelines for video play activity.

Setting.label: DLNA default protocol info
Setting.summary: Protocol info string used in GetProtocolInfo responses by the DLNA server.

Setting.label: DLNA media renderer discovery interval
Setting.summary: Number of seconds between DLNA media renderer discovery requests.

Setting.label: DLNA server announcement lease time
Setting.summary: Duration in seconds of DLNA Server SSDP announcement lease time.

Setting.label: DLNA server description icons
Setting.summary: Icons offered by DLNA server when devices request server description.

Setting.label: Run scanner tasks at a lower priority
Limit remote stream bitrate
Setting.summary: Set the maximum bitrate of a remote stream from this server.

Setting.label: External network total upload limit (kbps)
Setting.summary: Speed at which to limit the total bandwidth not on the local network in kilobits per second. Use 0 to set no limit.

Setting.label: Remote streams allowed per user
Setting.summary: Maximum number of simultaneous streams each user is allowed when not on the local network.

Setting.label: LAN Networks
Setting.summary: Comma separated list of IP addresses or IP/netmask entries for networks that will be considered to be on the local network when enforcing bandwidth restrictions. If set, all other IP addresses will be considered to be on the external network and will be subject to external network bandwidth restrictions. If left blank, only the server's subnet is considered to be on the local network.

Setting.label: Terminate Sessions Paused for Longer Than
Setting.summary: Value is in minutes. Terminate any sessions which have been paused for a longer time than specified amount of time.  Audio-only sessions and live sessions are excluded

Setting.label: Treat WAN IP As LAN Bandwidth
Setting.summary: Treat incoming requests from this network's WAN IP address as LAN requests in terms of bandwidth.  This often occurs when DNS rebinding protection is in place and clients on the LAN cannot contact the server directly but instead have to go through the WAN IP address.

Setting.label: Enable Relay
Setting.summary: The Relay allows connections to the server through a proxy relay when the server is not accessible otherwise.  Note: this proxy relay is bandwidth limited

Setting.label: Maximum simultaneous video transcode
Setting.summary: Limit the number of simultaneous video transcode streams your server can utilize

Setting.label: Enable Plex Media Server debug logging
Setting.summary: Debug logging enables additional detail in the log files and is helpful in diagnosing problems.

Setting.label: Enable Plex Media Server verbose logging
Setting.summary: Verbose logging is only useful to debug specific issues and should only be enabled if requested by support staff.

Setting.label: Allow Plex Media Server tokens in logs
Setting.summary: Media server tokens can be used to gain access to library content. Don't share logs containing tokens publicly. A server restart is required for a change to take effect.

Setting.label: Add Plex Media Server and System memory use for Debug Logging
Setting.summary: Logging of the Plex Media Server memory use and the system total used memory in Plex Media Server logs. A server restart is required for the change to take effect.

Setting.label: Custom server access URLs
Setting.summary: A comma-separated list of URLs (http or https) which are published up to plex.tv for server discovery.

Setting.label: List of IP addresses and networks that are allowed without auth
Setting.summary: Comma separated list of IP addresses or IP/netmask entries for networks that are allowed to access Plex Media Server without logging in. When the server is signed out and this value is set, only localhost and addresses on this list will be allowed.

Setting.label: Webhooks
Setting.summary: Allow this server to send events to external services.

Setting.label: Time at which tasks start to run
Setting.summary: The time at which the server starts running background maintenance tasks.

Setting.label: Time at which tasks stop running
Setting.summary: The time at which the background maintenance tasks stop running.

Setting.label: Backup directory
Setting.summary: The directory in which database backups are stored.

Setting.label: Remove old cache files every week
Refresh local metadata every three days
Perform extensive media analysis during maintenance
Perform refresh of program guide data.
Fetch missing location names for items in photo sections
Generate video preview thumbnails
Setting.summary: Video preview thumbnails provide live updates in Now Playing and while seeking on supported apps. Thumbnail generation may take a long time, cause high CPU usage, and consume additional disk space. You can turn off thumbnail generation for individual libraries in the library's advanced settings.
Setting.enumValues: never:never|scheduled:as a scheduled task|asap:as a scheduled task and when media is added

Setting.label: Video preview thumbnail frame duration
Setting.summary: The time (in seconds) between each video preview frame.

Setting.label: Generate intro video markers
Setting.summary: Detects show intros, exposing the 'Skip Intro' button in clients.
Setting.enumValues: never:never|scheduled:as a scheduled task|asap:as a scheduled task and when media is added

Setting.label: Generate chapter thumbnails
Setting.summary: Chapter thumbnails provide images in the chapter view on supported apps. They can take a long time to generate and consume additional disk space.
Setting.enumValues: never:never|scheduled:as a scheduled task|asap:as a scheduled task and when media is added

Setting.label: Analyze audio tracks for loudness
Setting.summary: Loudness analysis allows various features, such as loudness leveling and smart transitions. It can take a long time to complete when analyzing many tracks, and cause high CPU usage.
Setting.enumValues: never:never|scheduled:as a scheduled task|asap:as a scheduled task and when media is added

Setting.label: Analyze audio tracks for sonic features
Setting.summary: Sonic analysis allows various features, such as track radio. It can take a long time to complete when analyzing many tracks, and cause high CPU usage.
Setting.enumValues: never:never|scheduled:as a scheduled task|asap:as a scheduled task and when media is added

Setting.label: Location visibility
Setting.summary: Server owners may wish to restrict who can see location names for items which contain geolocation metadata. By default only the server owner will have visibility of these.
